skill.name: proxychains
skill.description: Auto-detect network issues and force proxy usage with proxychains4. Use this skill when encountering connection timeouts, DNS failures, or blocked network access. Default proxy is http://127.0.0.1:9910
skill.summary: Auto-detect network issues and force proxy usage with proxychains4. Use this skill when encountering...
skill.author: 2025Emma

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate network proxy configuration skill for proxychains4. It provides documentation and a setup script to configure network proxying through a local proxy server. All operations are transparent and match the stated purpose.

content.user_title: Auto-detect network issues and use proxy
content.value_statement: Network connection failures block development work. This skill helps Claude automatically route network traffic through proxychains4 when timeouts, DNS failures, or blocked access occur. Configure once and let Claude handle proxy routing automatically.
actual_capabilities: Auto-detect network errors (timeouts, connection refused, DNS failures)
Automatically prepend proxychains4 to failed commands
Support git, pip, npm, curl, wget, docker operations through proxy
Provide troubleshooting guidance for proxy issues
limitations: Requires proxychains4 to be installed on the system
Requires a running proxy service at configured address
Does not work with statically linked binaries
Only supports TCP connections, not UDP

use_cases.title: Access blocked resources
use_cases.description: Automatically route git, pip, and npm commands through proxy when accessing GitHub, PyPI, or npmjs from restricted environments.

use_cases.title: Configure proxy automation
use_cases.description: Set up automatic proxy routing for docker pulls, curl requests, and system updates when corporate proxies are required.

use_cases.title: Enable network problem resolution
use_cases.description: Let AI assistants automatically handle network connectivity issues without manual proxy configuration each time.

prompt_templates.title: Basic proxy check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if network connectivity works. If there are connection failures, use proxychains4 to retry the operation.

prompt_templates.title: Install through proxy
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the required packages using pip/npm. If the installation fails due to network issues, use proxychains4 to retry.

prompt_templates.title: Clone repository
prompt_templates.prompt: Clone the repository from GitHub. If direct connection fails, use proxychains4 to route the git clone command through the proxy.

prompt_templates.title: Configure proxy settings
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if proxychains4 is installed and properly configured. If not, set up the configuration for 127.0.0.1:9910 and test the connection.

output_examples.input: Clone the requests library repository from GitHub
output: Detected direct connection failure. Using proxychains4...

best_practices: Install proxychains4 before using this skill (apt install proxychains4 or brew install proxychains-ng)
Ensure your proxy service is running at 127.0.0.1:9910 before attempting network operations
Test proxy connectivity separately if commands continue to fail
anti_patterns: Using this skill without a running proxy service (will cause all commands to fail)
Assuming proxychains works with statically linked binaries
Forgetting that UDP-based connections are not supported

faq.question: What operating systems are supported?
faq.answer: Linux (Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS, RHEL, Fedora, Arch), macOS, and WSL. proxychains4 must be installed separately.

faq.question: What is the default proxy address?
faq.answer: The default proxy is http://127.0.0.1:9910. Configure your proxy software to listen on this port.

faq.question: Does this work with Docker?
faq.answer: Yes. Use proxychains4 docker pull image:tag to pull images through the proxy when direct access fails.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only routes existing network traffic through your configured proxy. No data is collected or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why do commands still fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: proxy service not running, wrong port configured, firewall blocking the proxy port, or using a statically linked binary.

faq.question: How is this different from environment variables?
faq.answer: proxychains4 intercepts system calls at the library level, forcing ALL TCP connections through the proxy without modifying individual commands.
